greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of psi(q) * psi(q^3) * phi(q^3) / phi(q) in powers of q where psi(), phi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/2) * eta(q) * eta(q^4)^2 * eta(q^6)^7 / (eta(q^2)^3 * eta(q^3)^3 * eta(q^12)^2) in powers of q.
a(n) = b(2*n + 1) where b() is multiplicative with b(2^e) = 0^e, b(3^e) = (-1)^e, b(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 4), b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e)/2 if p == 3 (mod 4).
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, 0, Module[ {m = n}, If[ Mod[n, 6] == 1, m = Quotient[ n, 3]; -1, 1] DivisorSum[ 2 m + 1, KroneckerSymbol[ -4, #] &]]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Nov 11 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, if( n%6==1, n\=3; -1, 1) * sumdiv(2*n + 1, d, kronecker(-4, d)) )};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 16 2007
